meanings.definition: Two people who jointly hold the position of chairman.
meanings.sent1: The cochairmen led the meeting together.
meanings.sent2: The cochairmen made important decisions for the organization.
meanings.sent3: The cochairmen joked about needing a bigger office to fit both their chairs.
meanings.sent4: The cochairmen were like two sides of the same coin, always in sync.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cochairmen sitting side by side was a symbol of unity.

meanings.definition: The act of serving as cochairmen.
meanings.sent1: Their cochairmanship brought fresh ideas to the committee.
meanings.sent2: The cochairmanship required effective communication between the two leaders.
meanings.sent3: The cochairmanship was like a dance, each taking turns leading.
meanings.sent4: The cochairmanship was a shared responsibility that they handled with ease.
meanings.sent5: The success of the project was attributed to their cochairmanship.
